moves.2. Nf3 g6 3. c3 Bg7 4. Bf4 Nf6 5. Nbd2 O: So I go with e4 for a change, I think black is going to have difficulties developing his other pieces
moves.7. e5 Nh5 8. Be3 b5: I did expect the bishop to move here so black could develop th knight via d7
moves.9. Bd3 a5: Queen side storm, am going to put my king away and complete my initial development
moves.10. O-O f5: Black is certainly aggressive with the pawns, but I think my pieces are better placed
moves.11. exf6 e.p. exf6 12. a4: time to give black something to think about
moves.12... b4 13. cxb4 axb4: I now have a passed pawn, well if I can get rid of everything else first ;)
moves.14. Nh4: Now to switch to the K side
moves.14... f5 15. Ndf3 f4: Black is opening up his K side, and that Bishop and Knight have still to move
moves.16. Bd2 Bxd4: I am going to get rid of this bishop, takes away a defensive piece for the black king, and will give my black bishop the edge hopefully
moves.17. Nxd4 Qxh4 18. Bxb4 Re8 19. Re1: Black's pieces are not working well together
moves.19... Nf6: Swapping makes sense especially as it put all of black's minor pieces on the back rank away from the action
moves.20. Rxe8+ Nxe8 21. Qe2: White takes control of the open file
moves.22. Be7 Qh6 23. Ne6 g5: Strange move, white just takes it, and black's king is exposed even further
moves.26... Nbd7: Move 26 and the other knight finally enters the fray, moving te bishop would have been better...
moves.27. fxg4 Re8: This game is all but over
moves.28. Qe6+ Kg7 29. Qf7+: Forcing the king into the corner
